summary: Birmingham is the second-largest city in the United Kingdom, located in the West Midlands region of England. With a population of over 1.1 million, it is known as the country's "second city." Historically, Birmingham was a market town that grew during the Industrial Revolution, earning the title "first manufacturing town in the world" by 1791. The city's economy now focuses on services, and it is an essential hub for trade, transportation, and education. Birmingham has faced challenges, including heavy bombing during World War II, but has since undergone significant regeneration. It is home to several renowned cultural institutions and hosted the 2022 Commonwealth Games.
title: Birmingham
